# TECHNICAL SPECIFICATION: WS-095 - GitHub Actions CI/CD Implementation
## Generated by Feature Development Session - 2025-08-22

### USER STORY & BUSINESS CONTEXT (THINK HARD - BE FACTUAL)
**As a:** WedSync development team and wedding suppliers
**I want to:** Automated testing and deployment pipeline that prevents broken wedding forms from reaching production
**So that:** Code changes are tested thoroughly before deployment, preventing couples from encountering broken forms during their vendor selection process

**Real Wedding Scenario:**
A photographer pushes a form update that breaks the "dietary restrictions" field right before a wedding weekend. Without CI/CD, this reaches production and couples can't submit their final headcount. With automated testing, the broken code is caught before deployment, preventing weekend crisis calls.

### SPECIFICATION SOURCE
- **Feature ID:** WS-095
- **Original Spec:** /CORE-SPECIFICATIONS/11-TESTING-DEPLOYMENT/02-CI-CD/01-github-actions md.md
- **Current Implementation:** 0% complete
- **Files to Modify:** 
  - None (all new workflow files)
- **New Files to Create:** 
  - /.github/workflows/ci.yml
  - /.github/workflows/deploy-staging.yml
  - /.github/workflows/deploy-production.yml
  - /.github/workflows/performance-tests.yml
  - /.github/workflows/security-scan.yml
  - /scripts/ci/setup-test-env.sh
  - /scripts/ci/deploy-preview.sh

### TECHNICAL DESIGN

#### Database Schema Required
```sql
-- Deployment tracking table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS deployments (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  deployment_id UUID DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  environment VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL, -- 'staging', 'production', 'preview'
  git_sha VARCHAR(40) NOT NULL,
  git_branch VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  git_tag VARCHAR(50),
  deployed_by VARCHAR(100),
  deployment_status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending', -- 'pending', 'success', 'failed', 'rolled_back'
  deployment_url VARCHAR(500),
  test_results JSONB,
  performance_metrics JSONB,
  error_logs TEXT,
  rollback_sha VARCHAR(40),
  deployed_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
  completed_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE,
  rollback_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE,
  metadata JSONB
);

-- CI/CD pipeline metrics
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS ci_cd_metrics (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  pipeline_run_id UUID DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  pipeline_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'ci', 'deploy', 'performance', 'security'
  git_sha VARCHAR(40) NOT NULL,
  git_branch VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  trigger_event VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'push', 'pull_request', 'schedule'
  pipeline_status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'running',
  started_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
  completed_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE,
  duration_seconds INTEGER,
  test_results JSONB,
  build_artifacts JSONB,
  error_details TEXT,
  metadata JSONB
);

-- Create indexes for performance
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_deployments_env_status ON deployments(environment, deployment_status);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_deployments_sha ON deployments(git_sha);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_ci_metrics_branch ON ci_cd_metrics(git_branch, pipeline_status);
```

#### API Endpoints Required
```typescript
// Deployment status API
export interface DeploymentStatus {
  deployment_id: string;
  environment: 'staging' | 'production' | 'preview';
  status: 'pending' | 'success' | 'failed' | 'rolled_back';
  git_sha: string;
  branch: string;
  deployed_by: string;
  deployment_url?: string;
  test_results?: {
    unit_tests: { passed: number; failed: number };
    integration_tests: { passed: number; failed: number };
    e2e_tests: { passed: number; failed: number };
    performance_tests: { passed: number; failed: number };
  };
}

// GET /api/deployments/status
// POST /api/deployments/webhook (GitHub webhook)
// GET /api/ci/metrics
// POST /api/ci/notify (Slack notifications)
```

#### Frontend Components Required
```typescript
// Deployment Dashboard (for dev team)
interface DeploymentDashboardProps {
  environment?: 'staging' | 'production' | 'all';
}

const DeploymentDashboard: React.FC<DeploymentDashboardProps> = ({ environment = 'all' }) => {
  return (
    <div className="deployment-dashboard">
      <DeploymentStatus environment={environment} />
      <PipelineHistory />
      <TestResultsSummary />
      <PerformanceMetrics />
      <QuickActions />
    </div>
  );
};

// CI/CD Status Badge Component
const CIStatusBadge: React.FC<{ branch: string }> = ({ branch }) => {
  const { data: status } = useQuery(['ci-status', branch], 
    () => fetch(`/api/ci/status/${branch}`).then(r => r.json())
  );
  
  return (
    <Badge variant={status?.status === 'success' ? 'success' : 'destructive'}>
      {status?.status === 'success' ? '✅ Tests Passing' : '❌ Tests Failing'}
    </Badge>
  );
};
```

#### Integration Points
```typescript
// CI/CD Service for managing deployments
class CICDService {
  async triggerDeployment(environment: string, sha: string) {
    // Trigger GitHub Actions deployment workflow
    const response = await fetch(`https://api.github.com/repos/${REPO}/actions/workflows/deploy-${environment}.yml/dispatches`, {
      method: 'POST',
      headers: {
        'Authorization': `token ${GITHUB_TOKEN}`,
        'Accept': 'application/vnd.github.v3+json'
      },
      body: JSON.stringify({
        ref: sha,
        inputs: { environment }
      })
    });
    
    return response.json();
  }
  
  async getDeploymentStatus(deploymentId: string) {
    // Query deployment status from database
    const deployment = await supabase
      .from('deployments')
      .select('*')
      .eq('deployment_id', deploymentId)
      .single();
    
    return deployment.data;
  }
  
  async rollbackDeployment(deploymentId: string, rollbackSha: string) {
    // Trigger rollback workflow
    await this.triggerDeployment('production', rollbackSha);
    
    // Update deployment record
    await supabase
      .from('deployments')
      .update({ 
        deployment_status: 'rolled_back',
        rollback_sha: rollbackSha,
        rollback_at: new Date().toISOString()
      })
      .eq('deployment_id', deploymentId);
  }
}
```

### CODE EXAMPLES

#### Example 1: Main CI Workflow
```yaml
# .github/workflows/ci.yml
name: CI Pipeline

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop, 'feature/*' ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main, develop ]

env:
  NODE_VERSION: '18'
  SUPABASE_URL: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_URL }}
  SUPABASE_ANON_KEY: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_ANON_KEY }}
  SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY }}

jobs:
  setup:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    outputs:
      node-cache-hit: ${{ steps.cache-node.outputs.cache-hit }}
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          
      - name: Cache node modules
        id: cache-node
        uses: actions/cache@v3
        with:
          path: ~/.npm
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-node-${{ hashFiles('**/package-lock.json') }}
          restore-keys: |
            ${{ runner.os }}-node-
            
      - name: Install dependencies
        if: steps.cache-node.outputs.cache-hit != 'true'
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npm ci

  lint-and-typecheck:
    needs: setup
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          
      - name: Restore node modules cache
        uses: actions/cache@v3
        with:
          path: ~/.npm
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-node-${{ hashFiles('**/package-lock.json') }}
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Run ESLint
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npm run lint
        
      - name: Run TypeScript check
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npm run type-check
        
      - name: Check code formatting
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npm run format:check

  unit-tests:
    needs: setup
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Run unit tests
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npm run test:unit -- --coverage
        
      - name: Upload coverage to Codecov
        uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
        with:
          file: ./wedsync/coverage/lcov.info
          flags: unit-tests
          fail_ci_if_error: true

  integration-tests:
    needs: setup
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    services:
      postgres:
        image: postgres:15
        env:
          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: postgres
          POSTGRES_DB: wedsync_test
        options: >-
          --health-cmd pg_isready
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Run database migrations
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npx supabase migration up --linked
        env:
          DATABASE_URL: postgresql://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/wedsync_test
          
      - name: Run integration tests
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npm run test:integration
        env:
          DATABASE_URL: postgresql://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/wedsync_test

  e2e-tests:
    needs: setup
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Install Playwright browsers
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npx playwright install --with-deps
        
      - name: Build application
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npm run build
        
      - name: Run E2E tests
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npm run test:e2e
        
      - name: Upload Playwright report
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
        if: always()
        with:
          name: playwright-report
          path: wedsync/playwright-report/

  build-and-deploy-preview:
    needs: [lint-and-typecheck, unit-tests, integration-tests]
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: github.event_name == 'pull_request'
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Build application
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npm run build
        
      - name: Deploy to Vercel Preview
        uses: amondnet/vercel-action@v25
        with:
          vercel-token: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN }}
          vercel-org-id: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_ORG_ID }}
          vercel-project-id: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_PROJECT_ID }}
          working-directory: ./wedsync
          
  security-scan:
    needs: setup
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Run dependency audit
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npm audit --audit-level moderate
        
      - name: Run CodeQL analysis
        uses: github/codeql-action/analyze@v2
        with:
          languages: typescript, javascript
          
      - name: Run Snyk security scan
        uses: snyk/actions/node@master
        env:
          SNYK_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.SNYK_TOKEN }}
        with:
          args: --all-projects --severity-threshold=medium

  notify-status:
    needs: [lint-and-typecheck, unit-tests, integration-tests, e2e-tests, security-scan]
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: always()
    steps:
      - name: Notify Slack
        uses: 8398a7/action-slack@v3
        with:
          status: ${{ job.status }}
          channel: '#dev-team'
          webhook_url: ${{ secrets.SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL }}
          fields: repo,message,commit,author,action,eventName,ref,workflow
```

#### Example 2: Production Deployment Workflow
```yaml
# .github/workflows/deploy-production.yml
name: Deploy to Production

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main ]
    tags: [ 'v*' ]
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      sha:
        description: 'Git SHA to deploy'
        required: true
        type: string

env:
  NODE_VERSION: '18'
  ENVIRONMENT: 'production'

jobs:
  pre-deployment-checks:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    outputs:
      deployment-id: ${{ steps.create-deployment.outputs.deployment-id }}
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          ref: ${{ inputs.sha || github.sha }}
          
      - name: Create deployment record
        id: create-deployment
        run: |
          DEPLOYMENT_ID=$(uuidgen)
          echo "deployment-id=$DEPLOYMENT_ID" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          
          # Record deployment in database
          curl -X POST "${{ secrets.SUPABASE_URL }}/rest/v1/deployments" \
            -H "Authorization: Bearer ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY }}" \
            -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
            -d '{
              "deployment_id": "'$DEPLOYMENT_ID'",
              "environment": "production",
              "git_sha": "${{ inputs.sha || github.sha }}",
              "git_branch": "${{ github.ref_name }}",
              "deployed_by": "${{ github.actor }}",
              "deployment_status": "pending"
            }'
            
      - name: Check staging deployment status
        run: |
          # Verify staging is healthy before production deployment
          response=$(curl -s -o /dev/null -w "%{http_code}" https://staging.wedsync.app/api/health)
          if [ $response -ne 200 ]; then
            echo "❌ Staging health check failed with status $response"
            exit 1
          fi
          echo "✅ Staging health check passed"
          
      - name: Run performance tests on staging
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: |
          npm ci
          npx playwright test tests/performance --config=playwright.config.staging.ts
          
      - name: Verify database migrations
        run: |
          # Check if migrations are applied and compatible
          echo "🔍 Verifying database migrations..."
          # Add migration verification logic here

  deploy-production:
    needs: pre-deployment-checks
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    environment: production
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          ref: ${{ inputs.sha || github.sha }}
          
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Build for production
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npm run build
        env:
          NODE_ENV: production
          NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL: ${{ secrets.PROD_SUPABASE_URL }}
          NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY: ${{ secrets.PROD_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY }}
          
      - name: Deploy to Vercel Production
        id: deploy
        uses: amondnet/vercel-action@v25
        with:
          vercel-token: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN }}
          vercel-org-id: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_ORG_ID }}
          vercel-project-id: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_PROJECT_ID }}
          vercel-args: '--prod'
          working-directory: ./wedsync
          
      - name: Update deployment status
        if: success()
        run: |
          curl -X PATCH "${{ secrets.SUPABASE_URL }}/rest/v1/deployments?deployment_id=eq.${{ needs.pre-deployment-checks.outputs.deployment-id }}" \
            -H "Authorization: Bearer ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY }}" \
            -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
            -d '{
              "deployment_status": "success",
              "deployment_url": "${{ steps.deploy.outputs.preview-url }}",
              "completed_at": "'$(date -u +"%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")'"
            }'

  post-deployment-tests:
    needs: [pre-deployment-checks, deploy-production]
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Run smoke tests on production
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: |
          npm ci
          npx playwright test tests/smoke --config=playwright.config.production.ts
          
      - name: Monitor production health
        run: |
          # Wait for deployment to propagate
          sleep 60
          
          # Check production health endpoints
          for endpoint in "/api/health" "/api/status" "/"; do
            echo "🔍 Checking https://app.wedsync.com$endpoint"
            response=$(curl -s -o /dev/null -w "%{http_code}" "https://app.wedsync.com$endpoint")
            if [ $response -ne 200 ]; then
              echo "❌ Health check failed for $endpoint with status $response"
              exit 1
            fi
          done
          echo "✅ All production health checks passed"
          
      - name: Notify deployment success
        uses: 8398a7/action-slack@v3
        with:
          status: success
          channel: '#deployments'
          webhook_url: ${{ secrets.SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL }}
          custom_payload: |
            {
              "attachments": [{
                "color": "good",
                "title": "✅ Production Deployment Successful",
                "fields": [
                  {"title": "Environment", "value": "Production", "short": true},
                  {"title": "SHA", "value": "${{ inputs.sha || github.sha }}", "short": true},
                  {"title": "Branch", "value": "${{ github.ref_name }}", "short": true},
                  {"title": "Deployed by", "value": "${{ github.actor }}", "short": true}
                ]
              }]
            }

  rollback-on-failure:
    needs: [pre-deployment-checks, deploy-production, post-deployment-tests]
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: failure()
    steps:
      - name: Trigger automatic rollback
        run: |
          echo "🚨 Deployment failed, initiating rollback..."
          
          # Get the last successful deployment SHA
          ROLLBACK_SHA=$(curl -s "${{ secrets.SUPABASE_URL }}/rest/v1/deployments?environment=eq.production&deployment_status=eq.success&order=completed_at.desc&limit=1" \
            -H "Authorization: Bearer ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY }}" \
            | jq -r '.[0].git_sha')
            
          if [ "$ROLLBACK_SHA" != "null" ]; then
            # Trigger rollback deployment
            curl -X POST "https://api.github.com/repos/${{ github.repository }}/actions/workflows/rollback.yml/dispatches" \
              -H "Authorization: token ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}" \
              -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
              -d '{
                "ref": "main",
                "inputs": {
                  "rollback_sha": "'$ROLLBACK_SHA'",
                  "failed_deployment_id": "${{ needs.pre-deployment-checks.outputs.deployment-id }}"
                }
              }'
          fi
          
      - name: Update deployment status to failed
        run: |
          curl -X PATCH "${{ secrets.SUPABASE_URL }}/rest/v1/deployments?deployment_id=eq.${{ needs.pre-deployment-checks.outputs.deployment-id }}" \
            -H "Authorization: Bearer ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY }}" \
            -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
            -d '{
              "deployment_status": "failed",
              "completed_at": "'$(date -u +"%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")'"
            }'
            
      - name: Notify deployment failure
        uses: 8398a7/action-slack@v3
        with:
          status: failure
          channel: '#deployments'
          webhook_url: ${{ secrets.SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL }}
          custom_payload: |
            {
              "attachments": [{
                "color": "danger",
                "title": "❌ Production Deployment Failed",
                "text": "Automatic rollback initiated",
                "fields": [
                  {"title": "Environment", "value": "Production", "short": true},
                  {"title": "SHA", "value": "${{ inputs.sha || github.sha }}", "short": true},
                  {"title": "Failed Job", "value": "${{ github.job }}", "short": true}
                ]
              }]
            }
```

#### Example 3: Performance Testing Workflow
```yaml
# .github/workflows/performance-tests.yml
name: Performance Tests

on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 */6 * * *' # Every 6 hours
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      environment:
        description: 'Environment to test'
        required: true
        default: 'staging'
        type: choice
        options: ['staging', 'production']

jobs:
  performance-tests:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: '18'
          
      - name: Install dependencies
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npm ci
        
      - name: Install Playwright browsers
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: npx playwright install --with-deps
        
      - name: Run performance tests
        working-directory: ./wedsync
        run: |
          if [ "${{ inputs.environment }}" == "production" ]; then
            npx playwright test tests/performance --config=playwright.config.production.ts
          else
            npx playwright test tests/performance --config=playwright.config.staging.ts
          fi
        env:
          ENVIRONMENT: ${{ inputs.environment || 'staging' }}
          
      - name: Process performance results
        run: |
          # Parse test results and send to monitoring
          node scripts/ci/process-performance-results.js
          
      - name: Upload performance report
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
        with:
          name: performance-report-${{ inputs.environment || 'staging' }}
          path: wedsync/performance-report/
          
      - name: Alert on performance regression
        if: failure()
        uses: 8398a7/action-slack@v3
        with:
          status: failure
          channel: '#performance-alerts'
          webhook_url: ${{ secrets.SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL }}
          custom_payload: |
            {
              "attachments": [{
                "color": "warning",
                "title": "⚠️ Performance Regression Detected",
                "text": "Performance tests failed on ${{ inputs.environment || 'staging' }}",
                "fields": [
                  {"title": "Environment", "value": "${{ inputs.environment || 'staging' }}", "short": true},
                  {"title": "Report", "value": "Check GitHub Actions for details", "short": true}
                ]
              }]
            }
```

### MCP SERVER USAGE

#### Required MCP Servers
- [ ] Context7: Load GitHub Actions documentation and CI/CD best practices
- [ ] Filesystem: Create workflow files and deployment scripts
- [ ] PostgreSQL: Store deployment metrics and status

#### Context7 Queries Needed
```typescript
await mcp__context7__get-library-docs("/actions/toolkit", "github-actions", 3000);
await mcp__context7__get-library-docs("/vercel/vercel", "deployment", 2000);
await mcp__context7__get-library-docs("/microsoft/playwright", "ci-integration", 2000);
```

### TEST REQUIREMENTS

#### CI/CD Pipeline Tests
```typescript
describe('CI/CD Pipeline Validation', () => {
  it('should validate all test stages pass', () => {
    // Lint, TypeScript check, formatting
    // Unit tests with coverage
    // Integration tests with database
    // E2E tests with real scenarios
    // Security scans
  });
  
  it('should handle deployment scenarios', () => {
    // Preview deployments on PRs
    // Staging deployments on develop
    // Production deployments on main
    // Rollback procedures
  });
  
  it('should monitor post-deployment health', () => {
    // Smoke tests after deployment
    // Performance monitoring
    // Error rate tracking
    // Automatic rollback triggers
  });
});
```

### ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA
- [ ] CI pipeline runs on all PRs and pushes
- [ ] Automated testing (unit, integration, E2E, performance)
- [ ] Preview deployments for PRs
- [ ] Staging deployment on develop branch
- [ ] Production deployment on main branch with approvals
- [ ] Automatic rollback on deployment failures
- [ ] Security scanning integrated
- [ ] Performance regression detection
- [ ] Slack notifications for deployment status
- [ ] Deployment tracking and metrics storage
- [ ] Health checks post-deployment
- [ ] Branch protection rules enforced

### DEPENDENCIES
- Must complete after: WS-091 (Unit Tests), WS-092 (Integration Tests), WS-093 (E2E Tests), WS-094 (Performance Tests)
- Must complete before: WS-096 (Deployment Pipeline), WS-097 (Environment Management)
- Shares code with: All features (CI/CD pipeline tests everything)

### ESTIMATED EFFORT
- Team A Frontend: 8 hours (workflow configuration and preview deployments)
- Team B Backend: 12 hours (database integration, API endpoints, notifications)
- Team C Integration: 16 hours (GitHub Actions setup, security scans, monitoring)
- Total: 36 hours
